data.meta_site_name: Victor Jr. Blue Devils Football and Cheer
data.text:
Get fired up!

It is our mission to teach our youth participants the fundamentals of football and cheer, to practice the ideals of good sportsmanship, scholarship and physical fitness. This will raise each player’s personal confidence, develop their compassion for others and provide them opportunities to take pride in their achievements.

People to know

Victor's best of the best. Learn about our legendary leaders and volunteers who set the bar high and made the program what it is today.

Named in honor of an incredibly special young man, meet the kids carrying on Tyler's legacy and love of the game.

Who are the people driving the program? Click here to find our leadership.

Our Teams

Flag Cheer (Competitive)

Introductory program that teaches the FUNdamentals of cheer with a focus on safety, sideline cheers, jumps, arm motions and simple choreography.

Grades K & 1

No experience necessary

Exhibition will be held at the end of the season to showcase all of their new skills

Learn More

Flag Cheer (Non-Competitive)

New in 2024! This non-competitive cheer option is tailored for cheerleaders in grades K through 2nd grade. This is an opportunity for participants to learn sideline cheers while learning to develop motions & jumps. Cheerleaders will practice once a week and perform a halftime routine during flag football games. This is also a good fit for those who are not quite ready for competitions. This option is a great way to build confidence while working on their skills!

Learn More

Flag Football

Our entry level football league, designed to introduce kids to game of football, with a focus on building skills.

Players (boys and girls) grades K-2

Weekly practice with games on Saturdays

Learn the basics of the game, improve overall athletic skills, learn to work as a team and have fun!

Learn More

Advanced Flag

Our newest offering, advanced flag brings new people to football. Whether that's athletes who aren't ready for contact just yet or those who simply enjoy the speed and excitement of the game, it’s designed to allow athletes to continue to participate in the game without the contact involved with tackle football.

Players in grades 3-7

2 weekly practices with games on Saturdays

Continue to build essential skills of the game, learn and play various positions, build a strong sense of team and build your love for the great game of football!

Learn More

C Team Cheer

Build on the skills learned in flag with an introduction into competitions, tumbling, stunting and more advanced choreography

Grades 2 & 3

At least one year on Flag is helpful but not mandatory

Competitions will occur in Sept/Oct. alongside cheering during the C Team Football season

Learn More

B Team Cheer

This program builds on the skills learned in C Team with an emphasis on advanced choreography, tumbling and stunting.

Grades 4 & 5

Experience in Cheerleading is preferred, but not mandatory

Competitions will occur in Sept/Oct. alongside cheering during the B Team Football season

Learn More

A Team Cheer

This program serves as a bridge between youth cheer and modified/JV/Varsity. Cheerleaders focus on advanced choreography, tumbling and stunting.

Grade 6 and 7

Experience in Cheerleading is preferred but not mandatory

Competitions will occur in Sept/Oct. alongside cheering during the A Team Football season

Learn More

C Team (Rookie Tackle)

A “bridge game” between flag and full tackle football. This modified version allows kids to play multiple positions every game, with no “special teams” and coaches on the field to help with instruction and encouragement. Played on a modified 40 yard field with an 8-on-8 ratio that encourages fundamentals, technique and speed.

3rd grade players only

Lower coach to player ratio

Practice 4 days/week in August, 2 weeknights once school starts. Games on Saturday or Sunday.

Learn More

B Team (Tackle)

Our youngest level of more traditional tackle football. Build on the fundamentals of the game, sportsmanship and teamwork.

Players in grades 4-5

Practice 4 days/week in August, 2 weeknights once school starts. Games on Saturday or Sunday.

Develop camaraderie, respect and have fun!

Learn More

A/B (In House Tackle)

New for the 2024 Season! Introducing our newly formed A/B In-house Tackle Team! Designed to cater to a diverse range of players and families, this innovative initiative promises an exciting blend of skill development, camaraderie, and game-time action!

All A/B players merge for joint practices before splitting into teams for intra-squad scrimmages. Led by head coaches from A and B Teams, our games feature live referees and structured play to ensure everyone gets significant playing time. Perfect for first-time players and families seeking a convenient football experience, our program addresses minimum playtime concerns while focusing on skill development and fun.

Learn More

A Team (Tackle)

The leaders of our program, the “A” team continues to expand a player’s game IQ, unique skills and work ethic.

Players in 6th and 7th grade

Practice 4 days/week in August, 2 weeknights once school starts. Games on Saturday or Sunday.

Develop discipline, respect and leadership a player can take to every arena.

Learn More

2024 Victor Scholastic Registration Dates

Thank you to our 2024 Season Dining Devil, Spirit, Blue & Gold and Gold Sponsors!
